Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery panel amphora; exterior: black on neck; lotus and palmette frieze above panel, in which the ends of two objects are preserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 127, pl. XXXIX, no. 355.2)
CVA Boston I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum, USA Fasc. 14, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, Fasc. 1 (p.44, pl. 58, no.4)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 235, no. 211)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0890)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4764 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
